titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. M. E. Baldwin, Judgment
CWG6429

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives

body.p:
October Term 1864
December 8 1864.
The Commonwealth } Plff
vs
M E Baldwin } Deft.

The defendant being solemnly called to appear or discharge of the recognizance entered into by him in the City Court of Louisville on the 5 day of August 1864, came not but made default. It is therefore considered by the Court that the Clerk of this Court issue a summons in the nature of a scire-facias against the said M E Baldwin together with W G Gaslin his bail returnable to the first day of the next term of this Court to shew cause if any they have or can why the Commonwealth shall not have judgment and execution thereon against them for four hundred dollars each, according to the form and effect of said recognizance, and for a breach of the Condition thereof

And at a Court continued and held for the Jefferson Circuit on the first day of May 1865 came the plaintiff by attorney and the defendant W H Gazlin being duly summoned and failing to answer It is
considered by the Court that the plaintiff recover of said defendant the sum of four hundred dollars the debt in the summons mentioned also her costs herein expended and May have Exentd.

A Copy
att Jas P Chambers c J c c
